p: The first clinical symptoms of HCC patients are shown in Fig 2. Practically the majority of the patients in our study were symptomatic. In most cases, one patient had multiple symptoms. The most significant number of patients were recorded with upper abdominal pain, nearly 70 (88%). Around 67 (84%) patients lost weight during the disease period. A large proportion of HCC patients had anorexia, about 62 (78%). There were some other complications such as pain in the right shoulder, fever, headache, and vomiting reported by 42 (52%), 51 (64%), 36 (45%), and 33 (41%) patients, respectively.
